title: What is the Physics of Consciousness? A Comprehensive Look at Trance and Quantum Psychology
first_phrase: This text is about Quantum Psychology, developed by Dr. Stephen Wolinsky and Kristi L. Kennett. The last 200 tokens of the text include Chapter 9 to the Appendices of the book "Trances People Live: Healing Approaches in Quantum Psychology." The chapter explores Dissociation and Posthypnotic Suggestion, while the Appendices delve deeper into techniques for deconstructing phobic responses and utilizing archetypes. Margaret O. Rym, a writer and editor, co-edited the four-volume series, The Workshops, Seminars and Lectures of Milton H. Erickson.

last_phrase: In conclusion, "In Trances People Live" by Dr. Wolinsky presents a fascinating integration of Eastern philosophy, Western religion, and physics, providing a new way of looking at daily life as a process of trance. With his unique background, the author creates a compelling piece of literary choreography that is studious, thought-provoking, and even humorous at times, making for an enjoyable and legitimate read.
